details.title: On Identifying Transfer Functions and State Equations for Linear Systems
details.abstract: Two methods are established for identifying constantcoefficient C2n-type noise-free linear systems if the time response data of the input-output or of all states are known. 2n response data are required to identify an nth-order transfer function or state equation for an unknown linear system. The order of the unknown system can be identified by checking a sequence of determinants. The Z transform and its inversion are mainly used.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
